New Records: Pete Alonso became the first major leaguer to hit a go-ahead homer when his team was trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all postseason game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer off All-Star closer Devin Williams in the ninth inning.
Jake Bauers and Sal Frelick broke a scoreless tie by opening the seventh inning with back-to-back homers.
Francisco Lindor opened the ninth inning with an eight-pitch walk.
Brandon Nimmo singled sharply on an 0-2 pitch to put runners at the corners.
Jesse Winker was hit by a pitch, stole second, and scored an insurance run on Starling Marte’s single to right.
Frelick led off the bottom of the ninth with a single, but Joey Ortiz struck out and Brice Turang hit into a double play to end the series.
Edwin Díaz pitched 1 2/3 innings of scoreless relief to earn the win.
David Peterson worked the ninth for his first major league save.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed excitement about keeping the team alive.
Manager Pat Murphy expressed his love for the team and the pain of the loss.
Devin Williams took responsibility for not executing well in the ninth inning.
Brandon Nimmo reflected on the team's resilience and their storybook season.
Sal Frelick expressed the pain of the loss but also a sense of group memory going into next year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game started out as a pitchers’ duel between Tobias Myers and Jose Quintana.
New York Mets advanced in the playoffs for the first time since winning the 2015 National League pennant.
The Mets will face the Philadelphia Phillies in a best-of-five Division Series.
